item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Well, personally i think America shouldn’t have to tolerate video surveillance. The idea of having everyone watched because of “terrorists” is probably a lie, the government is most likely just trying to be a “bigbrother” as referenced in the book “1984”. Terrorism can be stopped in many different ways, video surveillance isn’t going to stop or even prevent terrorism. If somebody wanted to attack an area of America, i think the last thing on the governments mind is “lets pull up camera 465339 and see what’s happening over there”.

People just need to accept that freedom is decreasing, and the government is only using this as a cover up as they’re basing it off America’s top most fear. Society prides themselves on freedom of choice and speech yet everything you choose and say is based of an influence already planted by the media. The media isn’t an independent body either, they’re controlled by the rich guys who usually coincide with government views.

Terrorism is just a practice of anger, if America didn’t want to be attacked they would stop picking on the little guys.
